result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah Thomas Koch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: If unable to post,  ordered to serve 3   consecutive days for contempt.  Debt will remain due and owing.

Defendant Noah Thomas Koch in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.
Plea - Ct.1 - NC.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.   Ct.2 - DRI.
$200+cc+DNA, 60 dtp, ftp 3 days RCJ for contempt

ADDRESS INFO for Noah Thomas Koch
Current: 907 Potter Road, Burlington, WI 53105 United States  (Effective: 05-14-2015)
Prior: 1511 Potter Rd, Burlington, WI 53105
Status conference on July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, ZCF and TJR (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Noah Thomas Koch in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
